text: Abdul Karim Koroma (born 25 September 1944) is a former Sierra Leonean politician. Koroma served in the Sierra Leonean government as Minister of Education (1977–1982), Regional Minister of the Northern Province (1982–1985), and foreign minister (1985–1992). From 1998 to 2000, Koroma served on the President's National Policy Advisory Committee during the end of the Sierra Leone Civil War. He has also been the High Commissioner to Australia.Australian Government, Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade,and High Commissioner to New Zealad, and Ambassador to The People's Republic of China, Republic of Vietnam, Japan, and was accredited to The Kingdom of Thailand, Indonesia, and Sri Lanka. Heads of Diplomatic Missions by Order of Precedence , accessed 27 August 2009. Author of the following publications: (1) Sierra Leone The Agony of a Nation and (2) Crisis and Intervention in Sierra Leone 1996 to 2003.
